TopicTitle: Few questions about mods (Kethane + Infernal Robotics)

Articles.Content:
So my reason why I have been staying away from mods is because I don't want my save game to crash next update and then I lose all/most of my progress. Also i've been hoping these would be added stock but i'm starting to lose hope.

Perhaps you guys can ease my mind a bit?

The 1 mod i'm looking at for now is the Kethane mod.

The other mod I'm looking for is the Infernal robotics mod or similar. (Recommendations?)

Is the winch mod included in it?

At last is my game going to get bugged in .24 if i have those 2 mods installed?

Thanks folks.

Edited February 3, 2014 by Tripzter
These sorts of questions go in the General Add-on Affairs subforum, so... moved!

i like to say kethane is one of those high quality mods that has a reasonably consistent asthetic, is incredibly useful, and it doesnt really feel like cheating because all the mapping you need to do to, and the precision landings you need to pull off.

infernal robitics is a pretty good improvement over damned robtics, it looks nicer and the animation is less wonky. i personally dont like the gui. id love to see it use action groups instead of keystrokes or gui clicks. you cant really get any precision out of it, and you cant program it to do exotic things like inverse kinematics. but for what it does it does it fine.

it doesnt have the winch, that would be the kerbal attachment system. i find the kas to be one of those buggy mods that usually causes more problems than it solves. but its kind of essential equipment for ground bases. you can of course live without it if all you are doing is collecting fuel.

i should point out that i use all these mods.

Thank you for the input Nuke.

Care to elaborate on why the KAS is buggy?

Thank you for the input Nuke.

Care to elaborate on why the KAS is buggy?

If you use KAS to attach parts to one another they have a tendency to randomly explode thanks to inaccurate physics calculations. It doesn't happen very often, but it is a real "Well, *****..." moment when it happens. It is rare enough that you can just ignore it though, KAS really adds a lot to the game. The skycranes and orbital debris tugs that it enables more than make up for the occasional rescue mission.

Oh and don't worry about Kethane breaking your game. Majir (The guy who makes Kethane) usually has a new version mere minutes after a patch, I think he has beta access or something. Mods in general don't tend to break your saves on updates. Worst that can happen is that you lose a few ships that rely on mod functionality.
So i started downloading some mods. Under the instructions on the infernal robotics mod i saw "Sandbox ok, Science not added yet" I take it i cant use it in my career profile? How about the rest?

So i started downloading some mods. Under the instructions on the infernal robotics mod i saw "Sandbox ok, Science not added yet" I take it i cant use it in my career profile? How about the rest?

KAS/Kethane are career ready. And every mod can be career ready made if you dont mind to edit the cfg files of the parts.

For the random KAS explosions , well, before you connect 2 things together (f.e. fuel lines) quicksave if something goes wrong you can reload and didnt lose anything.
